name: HIPAA Security Rule
description: The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act (HIPAA) Security Rule establishes national standards to protect individuals' electronic personal health information (ePHI) that is created, received, used, or maintained by a covered entity. The Security Rule requires appropriate administrative, physical, and technical safeguards to ensure the confidentiality, integrity, and security of ePHI.

domains.name: Administrative Safeguards
domains.description: Administrative actions, policies, and procedures to manage the selection, development, implementation, and maintenance of security measures to protect ePHI and to manage the conduct of the covered entity's workforce in relation to the protection of that information.

controls.title: Security Management Process
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures to prevent, detect, contain, and correct security violations. Conduct an accurate and thorough assessment of the potential risks and vulnerabilities to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of ePHI.

controls.title: Risk Analysis
controls.description: Conduct an accurate and thorough assessment of the potential risks and vulnerabilities to the confidentiality, integrity, and availability of electronic protected health information held by the covered entity or business associate.
typical_evidence: Risk register with identified threats and vulnerabilities
Asset inventory of systems containing ePHI

controls.title: Risk Management
controls.description: Implement security measures sufficient to reduce risks and vulnerabilities to a reasonable and appropriate level to comply with the general requirements of the Security Rule.

controls.title: Sanction Policy
controls.description: Apply appropriate sanctions against workforce members who fail to comply with the security policies and procedures of the covered entity or business associate.

controls.title: Information System Activity Review
controls.description: Implement procedures to regularly review records of information system activity, such as audit logs, access reports, and security incident tracking reports.

controls.title: Assigned Security Responsibility
controls.description: Identify the security official who is responsible for the development and implementation of the policies and procedures required by the HIPAA Security Rule for the covered entity or business associate.
typical_evidence: Job description for security officer role

controls.title: Workforce Security
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures to ensure that all members of the workforce have appropriate access to ePHI and to prevent those workforce members who do not have access from obtaining access to ePHI.

controls.title: Authorization and Supervision
controls.description: Implement procedures for the authorization and/or supervision of workforce members who work with ePHI or in locations where it might be accessed.

controls.title: Information Access Management
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures for authorizing access to ePHI that are consistent with the applicable requirements of the HIPAA Privacy Rule.

controls.title: Security Awareness and Training
controls.description: Implement a security awareness and training program for all members of the workforce, including management, covering security reminders, protection from malicious software, log-in monitoring, and password management.

controls.title: Security Incident Procedures
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures to address security incidents. Identify and respond to suspected or known security incidents, mitigate harmful effects, and document security incidents and their outcomes.
typical_evidence: Incident response team roster and contact information
Security incident log and tracking records

controls.title: Contingency Plan
controls.description: Establish and implement policies and procedures for responding to an emergency or other occurrence that damages systems containing ePHI, including data backup, disaster recovery, and emergency mode operation plans.

domains.name: Physical Safeguards
domains.description: Physical measures, policies, and procedures to protect a covered entity's or business associate's electronic information systems and related buildings and equipment, from natural and environmental hazards, and unauthorized intrusion.

controls.title: Facility Access Controls
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures to limit physical access to electronic information systems and the facilities in which they are housed, while ensuring that properly authorized access is allowed.

controls.title: Contingency Operations - Facility Security
controls.description: Establish and implement procedures that allow facility access in support of restoration of lost data under the disaster recovery plan and emergency mode operations plan.

controls.title: Access Control and Validation Procedures
controls.description: Implement procedures to control and validate a person's access to facilities based on their role or function, including visitor control and control of access to software programs for testing and revision.

controls.title: Workstation Use
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures that specify the proper functions to be performed, the manner in which those functions are to be performed, and the physical attributes of the surroundings of a specific workstation or class of workstation that can access ePHI.

controls.title: Workstation Security
controls.description: Implement physical safeguards for all workstations that access ePHI, to restrict access to authorized users only.
typical_evidence: Cable lock and secure area documentation

controls.title: Device and Media Controls
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures that govern the receipt and removal of hardware and electronic media that contain ePHI into and out of a facility, and the movement of these items within the facility, including disposal, media re-use, accountability, and data backup and storage.

domains.name: Technical Safeguards
domains.description: The technology and the policy and procedures for its use that protect ePHI and control access to it.

controls.title: Access Control
controls.description: Implement technical policies and procedures for electronic information systems that maintain ePHI to allow access only to those persons or software programs that have been granted access rights as specified in the information access management standard.

controls.title: Unique User Identification
controls.description: Assign a unique name and/or number for identifying and tracking user identity.

controls.title: Emergency Access Procedure
controls.description: Establish and implement as needed procedures for obtaining necessary ePHI during an emergency.

controls.title: Encryption and Decryption
controls.description: Implement a mechanism to encrypt and decrypt electronic protected health information when deemed appropriate.
typical_evidence: Encryption configuration evidence for data at rest

controls.title: Audit Controls
controls.description: Implement hardware, software, and/or procedural mechanisms that record and examine activity in information systems that contain or use ePHI.
typical_evidence: SIEM or log aggregation system documentation

controls.title: Integrity Controls
controls.description: Implement policies and procedures to protect ePHI from improper alteration or destruction. Implement electronic mechanisms to corroborate that ePHI has not been altered or destroyed in an unauthorized manner.

controls.title: Person or Entity Authentication
controls.description: Implement procedures to verify that a person or entity seeking access to ePHI is the one claimed.

controls.title: Transmission Security
controls.description: Implement technical security measures to guard against unauthorized access to ePHI that is being transmitted over an electronic communications network, including integrity controls and encryption.

domains.name: Organizational Requirements
domains.description: Requirements for covered entities and their business associates regarding business associate contracts and other arrangements, as well as requirements for group health plans.

controls.title: Business Associate Contracts
controls.description: A covered entity may permit a business associate to create, receive, maintain, or transmit ePHI on the covered entity's behalf only if the covered entity obtains satisfactory assurances that the business associate will appropriately safeguard the information through a written contract or arrangement.

controls.title: Business Associate Contract Requirements
controls.description: The contract between a covered entity and a business associate must meet specific requirements including implementing safeguards, reporting security incidents, ensuring subcontractors agree to the same restrictions, and making information available to the Secretary of HHS.
typical_evidence: Security incident reporting requirements in contracts

controls.title: Group Health Plan Requirements
controls.description: A group health plan must ensure that its plan documents provide that the plan sponsor will reasonably and appropriately safeguard ePHI created, received, maintained, or transmitted on behalf of the group health plan.
typical_evidence: Group health plan documents with security provisions
Plan sponsor certification of adequate safeguards
Plan amendment documentation addressing ePHI security
